page.title: 07Mr Kenneth Cockett-Memories
page.content: Mr Cockett has resided in Auckley for 55years,here are some of his memories. The main road has been widened & foot paths laid,bends have also been taken out.One bad bend was where the present fish shop is.60 houses & cottages & 6 farms.One farm retains same name;Ivy house.This had a slaughter house, supplying other villages & market. Eagle & Child has remained the same from outside except for addition of car parks.Next to pub there was a black smiths (Mr Dugger) & 2 cottages. River bridge has been widened,it use to have a hump back bridge.A working mans club was situated just before the pub,contained a room,billard table, & dartboard.Main shop opposite St. Saviours,another newsagents situated at Lidgett corner. Sand & gravel quarry down Eastfield Lane,owned by Bessacarr Gravel Company
